result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Macey M Peterson was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

IID TO COMMENCE WHEN THE DEF OBTAINS ANY TYPE OF VALID DL, OR WHEN THE DEF CHOOSES TO DRIVE W/O A VALID DL; SUBJECT TO FURTHER PENALTY
IID for a period of 2 years to any vehicle owned, operated or registered to the def.

miscConds.notes: Jail sentence WITH HUBER PRIVILEGES may be served in Pierce, Pepin, St Croix, Dunn or Polk County

Comply with all conditions set forth by the probation agent.
Successful completion of the St Croix County Drug Court, if admitted.
Mandatory alcohol assessment and driver's safety plan

records.addlTxt: had to remove an Information

Def will plead to Ct 1 and dismiss Ct 2.   State is recommending S/W probation 3 years
Conditions:  6 months jail, St Croix Co Drug Court Program - he has not yet been accepted.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  Def pleads guilty to Ct 1 of the Information.  Larimore stips to the facts.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty of Ct 1 and dismisses Ct 2.   State: s/w probation 3 years, cond: 6 months jail, and if admitted to St Croix Co Drug Court, complete that program.  If not accepted in Drug Court, probation will decide on his treatment.  Court:  fine of $1424, 6 month jail sentence, rev 36 months, IID, IID surcharge.  Larimore addresses the Court.  Asks to serve jail in St Croix County.  Def addresses the Court.

COURT ORDERS:
S/W PROBATION 3 YEARS
FINE:  $1424 PAY OVER PROBATION PERIOD 
JAIL:  6 MONTHS TO COMMENCE NO LATER THAN 07-11-2014 AT 7 PM 
HUBER ALLOWED AND CAN BE SERVED IN ST CROIX COUNTY AT NO COST TO PIERCE COUNTY
REV:  36 MONTHS
COMPLY WITH ALL CONDITIONS SET FORTH BY THE PROBATION AGENT 
SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF ST CROIX CO DRUG COURT, IF ADMITTED
MAND ALC ASSMT AND DRIVER'S SAFETY PLAN 
IID TO COMMENCE WHEN THE DEF OBTAINS ANY TYPE OF VALID DL, OR WHEN THE DEF CHOOSES TO DRIVE W/O A VALID DL; SUBJECT TO FURTHER PENALTY
IID for a period of 2 years to any vehicle owned, operated or registered to the def.

NO DNA SAMPLE OR SURCHARGE ORDERED 

(FINGERPRINT AND PHOTOGRAPH TODAY)  
Def asks about assessment.  Court: the assessor should know.
Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Court reads Information to the def.

Def waives his right to a preliminary hearing in this case.   Def understands his waiver of right to a preliminary hearing.    Court accepts waiver of preliminary hearing and binds defendant over for further proceedings.  The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Court reviews the plea questionnaire.  Def is 57 and has a HS diploma.  He will plead to 4th offense OWI in 5 years.  Ct 2 will be dismissed.

3:25 PM 
Defendant Macey M Peterson in court with attorney Joel K Larimore.  Sean E Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This will be an initial appearance, WOPH, arraignment.  Larimore had a McNeely motion on the CT file.   He is asking for the McNeely motion to apply in this case and the Court ruling apply.  State and the Court agree that everything in 13CT57 will transfer to this case.  Defendant has copy of complaint  Def understands the charges and the maximum penalties in counts 1 and 2.  Defendant waives further reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Larimore is privately retained.
